content: one-night hat by stitchnerd designs needle size 4 5mm/us7 or size needed to get gauge yarn worsted or aran - check gauge approx 70-140m/80-160yds knitting in the round use your favourite technique for the crown you can use dpn s 2 circulars magic loop or just work on a single circular and pick up the slack you can find more yarn ideas and projects linked to the pattern page on ravelry - link - you ll also be able to see exact yardage used for different hats noro silk garden on 4 5mm us7 gauge approx 16 stitches per 10cm/4 in pattern stitch abbreviations k = knit p = purl st s = stitch es sl1 pw wyib = slip 1 st purlwise with yarn in back k2tog = knit 2 sts together decreases 1 stitch ssk = slip 2 stitches separately knitwise then knit them together through the back loops hilltopcloud gradient handspun on 4 5mm us7 © ashcroft-hempsall 2016 - for personal non-commercial use only one-night hat 2 getting started if you are using a striping or gradient yarn you might like to think about which colour you want near your face to decide which end to start with - you may even need to cut off a tiny bit so that you get a nice chunk of colour at the start if you like a snug cuff you can use one size smaller needle for the cuff cast on 80 sts - using cable cast-on not too tightly link http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/10/cable-cast-on html cuff- optional with one size smaller needle row c1 purl one row without joining then join - mark the start of round round c2 knit to the end of the round round c3 purl to the end of the round repeat rounds c2 and c3 once or twice more 3 or 4 ridges then work from chart for main section main section rounds 1-8 work from the chart 4 x 20 sts = 80 try on after a few rounds to check the fit work in pattern stitch until you are ready to work the crown stopping after a round 8 options beanie approx 6 /15cm before starting the crown slightly slouchy approx 8 /20cm before starting the crown more slouchy more than 8 /20cm before starting the crown crown work rounds 9-25 once you will have 12 stitches remaining option if you like you can work one more round as ssk k1 to take it down to 8 sts finishing pull the yarn end through the remaining stitches to secure block lightly cowl for a cowl you can cast on any multiple of 4 stitches work the cuff and main section the same as for the hat stop after a round 3 or 7 reserving enough yarn for the top cuff chart top cuff start with a purl round then repeat rounds c2 and c3 to match the first cuff bind off knitwise after a purl round © ashcroft-hempsall 2016 -
